    Upcoming events

    January 2019: The ReproducibiliTea sessions will start again in Hilary Term. Follow us on twitter to keep up to date!

    February 2019: A new software carpentry workshop will be held - the date will be announced soon.

    Regular events

    Software and data carpentry workshops

    We organise software and data carpentry workshops that train researchers in the effective use of computational tools in research. The workshops are held in a partnership set up with Software Carpentry and Data Carpentry. The next workshop will be held in Hilary Term 2019!

    Organised by: Laura Fortunato

    ReproducibiliTea journal clubs

    Once a week during term time, researchers from various departments read a paper related to reproducibility and get together for discussion, snacks, tea, and open science! Find out more on the ReproducibiliTea twitter page.

    Organised by: Sam Parsons & Amy Orben

    Seminars on Reproducibility and Open Research

    Weekly seminars on Reproducibility and Open Research were held on Wednesdays 16:30 to 18:00 during Trinity and Michaelmas Term 2018. For more information and the schedule of speakers, please see the website.

    Organised by: Lisa Lodwick & Jasmine Nirody
